name: ADI Doria Grand Hotel

reviews.text: Clean and tidy hotel, nice comfortable rooms, breakfast and room service good. Close to central train station so can make day trips out to other regions. Staff polite and helpful.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in early August 2011. We walked from the train station to the hotel (not even ten minutes). The hotel is very close to a Metro Station (five minutes walk). Staff at reception are very professional and helpful. Breakfast is good (variety of pastries, breads, cereal, eggs, ham. cheeses, juices, coffee, etc). Mr. Antonio was our server and is a very nice gentleman. The rooms are VERY CLEAN. We loved it and we would stay again. It was not close to any main attraction (it is at least a 40 minutes walk to the Duomo) but once you start using the Metro everything will be much easier....AND.....there is a supermarket right across the street of the hotel!
reviews.title: Very Close to the Train Station and Very Clean
Near the train station but not the centre
reviews.text: The hotel was very nice for the price - room was nice and clean and breakfast was good - lovely custard croissants.

The location was handy for the train station and airport buses but a bit too far away from the centre for me. There was a metro stop nearby so it was easy to get into the centre that way - it would be a good walk though. That's said hotels closer to the centre were a good bit more expensive.
reviews.title: very comfortable and close to the Central Train Station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a small supermarket across the road which we liked.
reviews.title: Great hotel close to the main train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It has lots of positives for the tourist and is a haven from the hot hectic shopping streets of Milano. Good location near stazione centrale, not too seedy neighbourhood, no street noise, A/C worked well, lovely linen, big bed, big marble bathroom with powerful shower, good buffet breakfast, flat screen tv, a real key to get into the room and not a piece of plastic - quite rare these days! The carpet was quite old/worn but the room felt clean. The reception staff were nice and helpful overall even if they appeared icy at the start of our stay. Walking distance to the Corso Buenos Aires shopping street. Supermarket across the street. All up we would have liked to have stayed longer as it was very comfortable. Don't let the exterior put you off. This is a traditional, old-fashioned hotel - a nice break from the uber modern minimalist hotels that are everywhere and can be impersonal.
reviews.title: Great comfortable hotel, wished we could have stayed longer!

reviews.text: We chose the hotel for it's location and price. We didn't intent to go into the centre much, but did want access to restaurants and shops. Other then the shopping area in the centre, Corso Buenos Aires is the best place for a large variety of shops, at least a few days worth, and this hotel is located close to the head of the street. We also found numerous local restaurants that were perfectly good and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Very good value

reviews.text: The hotel is somewhat difficult to get into by car due to the split streets in the area, and there isn't any clear driveway or drop-off area either which was surprising for a hotel of this size, it just has 3 parking spots at the front. The parking station next door is fine with a daily rate of 28 Euro, but it has no direct lift into the hotel.
reviews.title: For value and locTioFor value and location we found this hotel to be very good.

reviews.text: We had 2 connecting rooms which were average sized but enough for the 5 of us. Very limited choice of TV channels, and not much of a view either, but overall we were perfectly happy with everything considering the price (less then a 1/3 of what you'd pay at the big 5 star hotels).
reviews.title: great hotel
Great Hotel
reviews.text: We booked this hotel on line and we were very pleased with our choice. The decor was gracious and quality and the rooms were spacious with comfortable beds. Breakfast was included but it was nothing to write home about. I would definitely stay here again when I go back to Milan.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night whilst passing through and Milan. We needed to be close to the main train station and the hotel was well located. The rooms were spacious and clean and the breakfast was excellent. The staff were not overly friendly or helpful however the hotel served the main purpose of being close to the station so the staff's attitude was not a huge problem.
reviews.title: Well located near the main train station and clean rooms

reviews.text: Very impressed with this hotel after a bad experience at Madison Rome. Rooms were big. Good View and airy. Bahrooms amenities were excellent. Ideally located with easy access to all but quiet too. Highy recommended.
reviews.title: Excellent Property
A restful and comfortable hotel
reviews.text: The Doria Grand is a lovely, well-maintained property that is close to the Stazione Centrale and shopping along Corso Buenos Aries. The staff was very pleasant, the room was quite comfortable, and the breakfast offered a delightful way to start the day. The hotel also offers a very nice bar (that, during our stay, had a series of jazz performances). Overall, I'd strongly recommend this property, and I would gladly stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Doria Grand lived up to expectations
reviews.title: Great Break
Bed bugs or fleas??!
reviews.text: The hotel is just a few minutes walk from Milan Central Railway Station and the arrival point for the airport buses though this means that it is someway away from the main attractions such as the Duomo etc. Don't let this put you off however as you are located very convenient for the Metro or the number 1 tram that will take you directly to the heart of the city. Remember to buy your tram ticket before you get on!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like many on TA, my husband and I were looking for a reasonably priced, comfortable hotel near Stazione Centrale for a one night stay in Milan before flying back to NY the next day. The reviews for some of the other hotels in the area sounded a bit depressing, so we decided on ADI Doria Grand after finding a decent rate on Expedia. I would highly recommend this hotel for travelers.
reviews.title: Grand hotel close to Stazione Centrale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: The location was perfect for us. We arrived into the Porta Genova trenitalia station, which was not ideal, but a 10 minute ride on the subway to Caiazzo brought us within half a block of the Doria Grand. When we went out to explore later, we made 2 rights and then strolled down Corso Buenos Aires (as suggested by one of the lovely concierges) all the way to the Duomo. It's a long walk but down an interesting street with lots of diversions (shops, foods, great people watching, beautiful buildings, etc.). Later, for dinner, we went to a wonderful restaurant called L'Osteria del Treno, located only about 5 minutes away from the hotel. When we checked out, we walked to Stazione Centrale, a mere 5 minutes away. Though I don't wholeheartedly recommend it if you have heavy suitcases, we did and we made it just fine onto the bus to Linate. If we had been spending more time in Milan, we probably would have wanted a more centrally located hotel, but it suited our needs well.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel for a stopover, but no where near the sights

reviews.text: Reception/concierge: Everyone at the front desk was pleasant and helpful. Check in and check out were a breeze.
reviews.title: Well appointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: After 5 hours of traveling, we entered the room and were very pleased. It's rather old fashioned, and there are some peculiar, somewhat outdated features (a lot of buttons in panels in the wall controlling everything from piped in music to lights to phone messages), but we found it extremely comfortable and there was a feeling of understated opulence to it. The room was very, very quiet, (the walls are padded) which we appreciated, and the bed was huge and comfortable. The bathroom was the only area that showed a little wear, but it was spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Super Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast: They offer a great breakfast. We were worried it would start too late for us, but it begins bright and early at 7 AM. They offer lots of breads, jams, spreads, fruit, yogurt, cereal, even eggs. This definitely upped the value for us, as it saved us both time and money.
reviews.title: Ok for the price

description: Located in the heart of Milan's business and shopping district, close to Corso Buenos Aires and Central Station. Nearby the new Porta Nuova district, easily accessible with the three underground lines.Art and cultural events are hosted in the hotel. We are the ideal choice for business travellers and for tourists wishing to enjoy a nice vacation.124 bright and soundproofed rooms, white Carrara Marble bathrooms. Delicious buffet breakfast included.
